game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(Player playerOne, Player playerTwo, game.State state)
      Constructs a new Game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getMessage()
      Get message about the game, mostly from players.
      game.State getState()
      Getter for state.
      int getWinner()
      Getter for the winner.
      boolean isDone()
      Checks if the game is over.
      void update()
      Update the game for one turn: 1) get move from current player 2) apply the move to the current game state 3) update the current player

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Player playerOne,
            Player playerTwo,
            game.State state)
        Constructs a new Game.
        Parameters:
        playerOne - the first player, not null
        playerTwo - the second player, not null
        state - the initial game state, not null

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public game.State getState()
        Getter for state.
        Returns:
        the state, not null

      • update

        public void update()
        Update the game for one turn: 1) get move from current player 2) apply the move to the current game state 3) update the current player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game is done, i.e., isDone returns true.

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        Getter for the winner.
        Returns:
        the player id of the winner or 0 if there is no winner
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game is not yet done, i.e., isDone returns false.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Checks if the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over and false otherwise

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Get message about the game, mostly from players.
        Returns:
        the message
